alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 30 at 3:46PM EST until December 01 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to possibly heavy lake effect snow and considerable blowing snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to locally 4 inches with the greatest snow amounts and poorest visibility along the Lake Superior shore from Grand Marais east to Crisp Point. West winds gusting as high as 50 mph could cause occasional whiteout conditions at times this evening. The heavier snow bands will gradually shift inland this evening as winds veer a bit more to the northwest. * WHERE...Alger and Luce Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially near the shoreline. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility near zero at times. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
